qas.question: Who arrived at the Marshall Islands in 1788?

answers.text: Captain John Charles Marshall and Thomas Gilbert

qas.question: What do natives of the Marshall Islands call their country?
Which Russian was involved in naming the Marshall Islands?
Which French citizen was involved in naming the Marshall Islands?
At what island did the Globe arrive in 1824?
Who notably accompanied John Charles Marshall to the Marshall Islands?
In what year did Marshall and Gilbert go to the islands?
What is the traditional name of the Marshall Islands?
What is the English translation of the traditional name of the Marshall Islands?
On what island did mutinous American whalers land in 1824?

context: <a0_0>Captain John Charles Marshall and <a5_0>Thomas Gilbert<a5_0/><a0_0/> visited the islands in <a6_0>1788<a6_0/>. The islands were named for Marshall on Western charts, although the natives have historically named their home "<a1_0><a7_0>jolet jen Anij<a7_0/><a1_0/>" (<a8_0>Gifts from God<a8_0/>). Around 1820, Russian explorer <a2_0>Adam Johann von Krusenstern<a2_0/> and the French explorer <a3_0>Louis Isidore Duperrey<a3_0/> named the islands after John Marshall, and drew maps of the islands. The designation was repeated later on British maps.[citation needed] In 1824 the crew of the American whaler Globe mutinied and some of the crew put ashore on <a4_0><a9_0>Mulgrave<a4_0/> Island<a9_0/>. One year later, the American schooner Dolphin arrived and picked up two boys, the last survivors of a massacre by the natives due to their brutal treatment of the women.:2
